questionTitle: Which of the following technology is used for syndicated content?
questionExplanation: RSS stands for Really Simple Syndication.

questionOption1: A syndication service is another way for people to send messages to a group of people
questionOption2: You can read RSS and Atom formatted content inside special applications called newsreaders
questionOption3: Web feeds also are used to follow blogger and wikis entries
questionExplanation: The technology behind syndication is simple, but the value of the content can be impactful.

questionTitle: How many technologies are used for most of the syndicated content on the Internet?
questionExplanation: Two technologies are behind most of the syndicated content being used on the Internet: RSS and Atom.

questionTitle: Which of the following file format is used by RSS module?
questionExplanation: RSS uses an XML file format and the concept of an RSS world or module.

questionOption1: In Gmail, you can construct searches with multiple operators using the Advanced Search feature
questionOption2: RSS and Atom are prototypes of a class of XML specifications called synchronized markup languages
questionOption3: A typical RSS document or feed contains text and metadata that can be used to indicate publication dates
questionExplanation: RSS and Atom are prototypes of a class of XML specifications called syndication markup languages.

questionTitle: Which of the following was developed an alternative to XML syndication by IETF?
questionExplanation: Atom has some structural differences with RSS, but is similar in approach and technology.

questionTitle: Which of the following is not an RSS module?
questionExplanation: The major browser providers use the feed icon to indicate that you can subscribe to content on that Web page.

questionTitle: Which of the following application is a newsreader?
questionExplanation: These are a class of applications whose entire purpose is displaying RSS content.

questionTitle: ___________ is an application for collecting messages sent in RSS and Atom format from information providers.
questionExplanation: These applications are sometimes referred to as newsreaders or aggregators.

questionTitle: What does the following figure give information about?
questionExplanation: A news aggregation Web site is one that relies on collecting the syndicated content from other Web sites in a form that can be viewed together.
